citation.article-title: Pseudosphingobacterium domesticum gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from home-made compost
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Pseudosphingobacterium (Pseu.do′sphing.o.bac.ter.i.um. Gr. adj. pseudes false; N.L. neut. n. Sphingobacterium a bacterial generic name; N.L. neut. n. Pseudosphingobacterium false Sphingobacterium).
Cells are non-spore-forming, Gram-negative, non-motile rods.
Positive for catalase, oxidase, aesculin hydrolysis and β-galactosidase.
Negative for arginine dihydrolase, lysine and ornithine decarboxylases, urease, tryptophan deaminase, citrate utilization and H2S, indole and acetoin production.
No specific growth factors are required.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite, but does not support anaerobic growth.
Sugars are used as single carbon sources.
Species of the genus have a DNA G+C content of around 40 mol%.
The summed feature C16 : 1/iso-C15 : 0 2-OH, iso-C15 : 0 and iso-C17 : 0 3-OH are the predominant fatty acids.
The type species is Pseudosphingobacterium domesticum.
